jobPostingInfo.title: FPGA Engineer III
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Come join a team that builds flight hardware to understand Earth’s climate.

We invite you to join the Gravity Sensing Instruments (335F) Group to serve as an Embedded Flight Software Engineer Level III to lead an FPGA design for the Mass Change mission. We seek an FPGA specialist to develop and test critical control, telemetry, and signal processing algorithms that interact with the laser and optical reference cavity subsystems. The Laser Ranging Interferometer (LRI) electronics makes highly precise measurements of inter-spacecraft distances as they change due to Earth’s gravitational field.

You will be part of a high-performing team of hardware, firmware, and research electronic and optical engineers developing and implementing the LRI for NASA. You will be responsible to work with a team testing and demonstrating LRI performance goals. You will also be a key member of the group that develops other laser-based metrology instruments.

Tasks include:

  • Lead an FPGA team from initial concept through implementation

  • Maintain detailed FPGA design documentation

  • Develop FPGA design architectures

  • Implement FPGA designs for advanced instruments

  • Lead FPGA design reviews

  • Verify FPGA design meets requirements

  • Support team with board/assembly/instrument level tests

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or a related discipline with a minimum of 6 years of related work experience; or Master’s degree in a related discipline with a minimum of 4 years of related experience; or PhD degree in related discipline with a minimum of 2 years related experience.

  • 5+ years of experience with FPGA design and verification.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Desired Skills:

  • Very strong experience designing, implementing, and testing advanced FPGA systems

  • Experience developing signal processing algorithms with implementation on FPGA in Verilog, SystemVerilog, and MATLAB Simulink HDL Coder

  • Experience with universal verification methodology, regression testing, hardware in the loop testing, and continuous integration tools like Jenkins

  • Experience with phase-locked-loops and control systems, pseudorandom number codes, modulation, and ranging techniques and related algorithms.

  • Experience designing with radiation tolerant Xilinx and Microsemi FPGAs

  • Experience with Xilinx ISE/Vivado, Microsemi Libero SoC, Synplify Pro/Premier, and Mentor Graphics Questa design tools

  • Good understanding of communication protocols: SpaceWire, MILSTD-1553, SPI, UART

  • Experience using benchtop power supplies, oscilloscopes, synthesizers, and spectrum analyzers to test FPGA designs

  • Experience writing software in Python, Tcl, or C to control and test FPGA designs

  • Success infusing new design/verification technologies and methodologies

  • Skillfully handles fast pace and dynamic product development environment

  • Outstanding leader able to build consensus as well as excellent written/verbal communication skills

  • Knowledge of NASA, JPL and industry practices and standards related to flight instrument design and test. Demonstrated leadership, verbal and written communications and organizational skills. Ability to collaborate with multiple organizations, technical disciplines, and across various levels of management.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
